page.title: 12Harpur-Crewe Estate
page.content: The Harpur-Crewe estate was founded in the early 1500s by Richard Harpur who was a solicitor in London. One of his ancestors, Henry Harpur married Lady Jane Crewe, and Heiress. The family seat is at Calke Abbey, Melbourne, near Derby. When the Harpur-Crewe Estate was at its height you could walk from one side of Warslow to Derby. Richard Harpur-Crewe the second died during World War I of cancer. When the tenants were renting Harpur-Crewe farms they were told not to spread lime otherwise it would kill the heather which would leave Sir Vauncy no grouse to shoot. There is a hall near Warslow which is owned by the Harpur-Crewe family. Miss Hermione, who is Charles Harpur-Crewe's sister lives there.
